results.summary: A mother whose 16-year-old son and his best friend were killed in separate stabbings has called for more action to tackle knife crime.
results.body: <body xmlns="http://www.bbc.co.uk/asset" xml:space="preserve" xml:base="http://www.bbc.co.uk/article/c01b9288-2e2a-7546-87f4-de43046a788e"><paragraph>A mother whose 16-year-old son and his best friend were killed in separate stabbings has called for more action to tackle knife crime. </paragraph><paragraph>Kyle Sheehan and Joshua Ribera from Birmingham were killed a year apart. </paragraph><paragraph>Joshua died last month as he was leaving a fundraiser in Kyle's memory. </paragraph><paragraph>BBC correspondent Peter Wilson reports.</paragraph></body>

70242260.altText: Hayley Sheehan. mother of Kyle Sheehan

70238073.caption: The mother of stabbed Kyle Sheehan has called for tougher measures on knife crime

image.altText: Hayley Sheehan, mother of Kyle Sheehan

items.summary: The mother of a teenager killed in a stabbing in Birmingham calls for more action to combat knife crime, on the day a man admits the manslaughter of another teenager in the city.
items.headline: Christina Edkins: Mother of Kyle Sheehan calls for knife crime action
items.shortHeadline: Mother calls for knife crime action

items.title: AV content promotion hyperpuff - importers - LIVE

results.headline: Kyle Sheehan's mother warns stabbings will continue
